name: Congee
description: A classic rice porridge dish
instructions: 1. Rinse the rice. 2. In a pot, combine rice and water/broth. 3. Bring to a boil, then simmer. 4. Add minced ginger and cook until rice is soft. 5. Season with soy sauce and top with green onions and a drizzle of sesame oil.

name: Dim Sum Buns
description: Steamed buns with savory fillings
instructions: 1. Mix flour, water, sugar, and yeast. 2. Knead into a dough, then let it rise. 3. Roll dough into small circles. 4. Fill with seasoned ground pork or shrimp. 5. Steam for 15-20 minutes. 6. Serve with soy sauce and a drizzle of sesame oil.

name: Kimchi Pancakes
description: Savory pancakes with kimchi
instructions: 1. Mix flour, chopped kimchi, kimchi juice, and green onions. 2. Heat oil in a pan. 3. Spoon batter into the pan, cook until golden. 4. Flip and cook the other side. 5. Serve with soy sauce and a drizzle of sesame oil.

name: Idli
description: South Indian steamed rice cakes
instructions: 1. Soak rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds. 2. Grind into a batter. 3. Add salt and let it ferment. 4. Pour batter into idli molds. 5. Steam for 10-15 minutes. 6. Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Roti Canai
description: Malaysian flatbread with curry
instructions: 1. Mix flour, water, and condensed milk into a dough. 2. Divide into balls, coat with ghee. 3. Flatten and stretch dough. 4. Cook on a hot griddle until golden. 5. Serve with curry sauce and dhal curry.

name: Pho Bo
description: Vietnamese beef noodle soup
instructions: 1. Cook rice noodles. 2. Heat beef broth. 3. Arrange noodles and beef in a bowl. 4. Pour hot broth over. 5. Top with bean sprouts, basil, lime, and sriracha.

name: Chicken Teriyaki
description: Delicious Japanese-style grilled chicken with teriyaki sauce.
instructions: Combine soy sauce, sake, mirin, and sugar in a bowl to make the teriyaki sauce.
Marinate chicken breasts in the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a pan and grill chicken until fully cooked.
Brush additional teriyaki sauce while grilling for extra flavor.
Slice chicken and serve with rice.

name: Pad Thai
description: A classic Thai stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of flavors.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened, then drain.
In a bowl, mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar to create the sauce.
Stir-fry garlic in vegetable oil, add tofu and cook until golden.
Push tofu to the side, add beaten eggs, scramble, and mix with tofu.
Add soaked noodles and sauce, stir-frying until well combined.
Add bean sprouts, toss, and serve topped with chopped peanuts and lime wedges.

name: Bibimbap
description: A Korean mixed rice dish with vegetables, gochujang, and a fried egg.
instructions: Place rice in a bowl, arrange vegetables on top in separate sections.
Place a fried egg in the center.
Drizzle gochujang and sesame oil over the top.
Mix everything together before eating to combine flavors.

name: Tom Yum Soup
description: A spicy and sour Thai soup with shrimp, mushrooms, and herbs.
instructions: In a pot, bring broth to a boil with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
Add shrimp, mushrooms, and tomato. Cook until shrimp turns pink.
Season with fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste.
Remove lemongrass, lime leaves, and galangal slices before serving.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: A savory Chinese stir-fry with tender beef and crisp broccoli.
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and sugar to make the sauce.
Marinate sliced beef in the sauce for at least 15 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or skillet, stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add marinated beef and cook until browned, then add broccoli and stir-fry until tender.
Serve over cooked white rice.

name: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
description: Fresh and healthy Vietnamese spring rolls with shrimp, vegetables, and herbs.
instructions: Dip a rice paper wrapper in warm water to soften, then lay it on a flat surface.
Arrange shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, and bean sprouts on the wrapper.
Fold the sides of the wrapper and roll tightly to enclose the filling.
Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Serve with peanut sauce for dipping.

name: Pad Thai
description: A classic Thai stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and salty flavors.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened.
Heat oil in a wok, add garlic and tofu, stir-fry until golden.
Push tofu to one side, pour beaten eggs into the wok, scramble and mix with tofu.
Add soaked noodles, bean sprouts, and peanuts. Stir-fry until well combined.
Toss in green onions and lime wedges. Serve hot.

name: Sushi Rolls
description: Delicious Japanese sushi rolls filled with a variety of ingredients.
ingredients: 2 cups sushi rice, cooked and seasoned
Soy sauce and wasabi for serving
instructions: Place a bamboo sushi rolling mat on a flat surface, put a sheet of nori on top.
Spread a layer of sushi rice on the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
Arrange slices of fish, avocado, and cucumber along the bottom edge of the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the mat, seal the edge with water.
Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

name: Chicken Curry
description: A fragrant and flavorful South Asian chicken curry with a rich blend of spices.
instructions: In a pot, heat oil and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add curry powder and cook for a minute. Add chicken and brown on all sides.
Pour in coconut milk, add potatoes and peas. Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Bibimbap
description: A Korean mixed rice dish topped with a variety of seasoned vegetables, meat, and a fried egg.
ingredients: 1 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced and sautéed
Sesame oil and gochujang sauce for drizzling
instructions: Divide the cooked rice into serving bowls.
Arrange carrots, spinach, bean sprouts, mushrooms, and beef on top of the rice.
Drizzle with sesame oil and gochujang sauce to taste.
Top each bowl with a fried egg. Mix everything together before eating.

name: Tom Yum Soup
description: A hot and sour Thai soup with a delicious combination of shrimp, mushrooms, and aromatic herbs.
instructions: In a pot, bring chicken broth to a boil. Add lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.
Add shrimp, mushrooms, fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste. Simmer until shrimp is cooked.
Remove lemongrass and lime leaves. Adjust seasoning if needed.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: A quick and tasty Chinese stir-fry featuring tender slices of beef and crisp broccoli in a savory sauce.
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce. Set aside.
Heat oil in a wok, stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add sliced beef and cook until browned. Add broccoli and sauce mixture.
Stir-fry until broccoli is tender and the sauce coats the beef and broccoli.
Serve over cooked rice.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
description: A classic Thai dessert with sweet sticky rice and ripe mango slices.
instructions: Rinse the glutinous rice until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice in a steamer until tender.
In a saucepan, heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt until sugar dissolves.
Pour the coconut mixture over the cooked rice and let it soak for 30 minutes.
Serve the sticky rice with mango slices on top and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Matcha Green Tea Mochi
description: Delicate Japanese mochi filled with sweetened matcha-flavored red bean paste.
instructions: Mix mochiko, sugar, and matcha powder in a bowl.
Add water gradually, stirring to form a smooth batter.
Microwave the batter in a greased dish until set.
Cut into squares, fill with red bean paste, and dust with cornstarch.

name: Pandan Chiffon Cake
description: A light and fluffy Southeast Asian cake with the fragrant aroma of pandan leaves.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, mix pandan extract, coconut milk, oil, and egg yolks.
Fold wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form, then fold into the batter.
Pour into an ungreased tube pan and bake for 55-60 minutes.

name: Taiwanese Pineapple Cake
description: Buttery shortcrust pastry filled with sweet pineapple jam, a popular treat in Taiwan.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, cream together butter, powdered sugar, and salt.
Gradually add flour until a soft dough forms.
Divide the dough, press half into a pan, spread pineapple jam, and top with remaining dough.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
Cut into squares once cooled.

name: Filipino Halo-Halo
description: A colorful and refreshing shaved ice dessert with a mix of fruits, jellies, and sweet beans.
instructions: Fill a glass with shaved ice.
Layer with sweetened fruits, sweet beans, leche flan, and jellies.
Drizzle with evaporated milk and top with a scoop of ube ice cream.

name: Indian Gulab Jamun
description: Soft and sweet fried dough balls soaked in cardamom-infused sugar syrup.
ingredients: For the sugar syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, cardamom pods
instructions: In a bowl, mix milk powder, flour, ghee, baking soda, and milk to form a dough.
Divide into small balls and deep-fry until golden brown.
In a separate saucepan, make a sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, and cardamom pods.
Soak the fried dough balls in the sugar syrup for a few hours before serving.
